header.title: Gin swigging men filmed hurling homophobic and racist abuse on London train
header.postText: An ex-policeman who was threatened by two men spouting a barage of racist and homophobic abuse on a train platform says he now fears for his child’s safety.', 'A video shows one of the men saying he will rob Adam Pugh, 33, after he asked them to stop calling a black person a ‘monkey’ and another man a ‘poof’.', 'He says ‘there’s no doubt in his mind’ that Brexit has made people more comfortable behaving in such a way after one of the men shouted: ‘After Brexit you can all f*** off’.’', 'Adam was helping a woman with a pushchair down the stairs at Bellingham Station, South London, when he heard the men shouting.', 'He told Metro.co.uk: ‘I could hear f’ing and blinding, one saying the N-word, w*g.’', 'The anti-racism campaigner says he saw the two men were hurling abuse at a black man sitting on the platform.', 'A woman with a child tried to intervene at which point they allgedly called her a ‘f** c**t’ and a ‘dyke’.', 'Then another man got involved, at which point the man in the high-vis jacket, sipping what looks like a can of pink gin calls him a ‘poof’ and a ‘queer’.', 'Recalling the incident, shortly before midday on Friday, Adam said: ‘I said “Is that really necessary there’s children around?”, he said “why are you getting involved?”, he said “I will smash your face in”.’', 'Adam says the pair abused people during the entire journey on the Thameslink service to Blackfriars.', 'A clip taken by a witness shows the man in the black top storming down the carriage and standing over Adam, repeatedly shouting ‘I will take everything you’ve got’.', 'Adam told him: ‘I’m just asking you politely,’ to which the man allegedly responded: ‘Stop being polite’.', 'After getting off at Elephant and Castle station the father-of-one says the men followed him and continued hurling abuse.', 'Adam says police arrived but failed to find the abusive pair.', 'The confrontation took place close to where Adam lives, and he is now worried about finding himself in a similar situation while out with his three-year-old son.', 'He said: ‘Everyone was pretty shaken up. They were literally abusing everyone.', '‘He said to me “You’re dressed like a monkey, you look like a monkey,” because apparently I’m dressed like I’m black.', '‘I was on my way to pick up my son from nursery, I’m thinking about the fact that I live nearby because I didn’t want to get recognised.’', 'A spokesperson from Govia Thameslink, which operates the train, said: ‘This is completely disgusting and unacceptable and has been reported to the British Transport Police.’', 'Metro.co.uk has contacted British Transport Police for comment.
